body_html: But this solution will not prevent shading of MKL's API. And for example ddot_ still will be taken from Numpy. This produces inconsistency between how one thinks Pytorch works and how it actually works. Probably some solution from here can help?
body_text: But this solution will not prevent shading of MKL's API. And for example ddot_ still will be taken from Numpy. This produces inconsistency between how one thinks Pytorch works and how it actually works. Probably some solution from here can help?
body: But this solution will not prevent shading of MKL's API. And for example `ddot_` still will be taken from Numpy. This produces inconsistency between how one thinks Pytorch works and how it actually works. Probably some solution from [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/678254/what-should-i-do-if-two-libraries-provide-a-function-with-the-same-name-generati/678309#678309) can help?
